translation.en: -[radio beeps] -[dispatch] Hey, Vicki.
Hey, I've got a new case.
It's a missing person report with a 61-year-old lady.
She lives with her son, but I've been told he has a history of violence.
translation.ko: 아들과 같이 산다는데 아들한테 폭행 전력이 있대요

translation.en: [dispatch] Okay.
[Vicki] Can you send some backup?
[Vicki] There's a light on inside.
The house is empty, like there's nothing in it.
translation.ko: 집이 텅 비었어요 싹 다 들어낸 것처럼

translation.en: I wonder what these things are?
[woman] It's weird. It's like… There's a toilet seat. There's a mattress.
translation.ko: 이상해, 변기 시트에 매트리스가 나와 있어

translation.en: [Vicki] Look, the carpet's pulled up.
[woman 2 on intercom] Hello?
I'm Investigator Rains with Richland County Sheriff's Department.
translation.ko: - 누구세요? - 레인스 수사관입니다 리칠랜드 카운티 보안관서에서 나왔어요

translation.en: Do you know a neighbor Lorraine Garcia? We're out here trying to find her.
translation.ko: 옆집의 로레인 가르시아를 아시나요? 지금 찾고 있거든요

translation.en: [woman 2] All I know is she told me her son Tony was mistreating her.
translation.ko: 로레인한테 들은 게 다인데 아들 토니가 자길 홀대한댔어요

translation.en: At times, she was being locked in a bedroom.
Things were being taken away.
Her bank card, her phone.
Okay.
[woman 2] The next time I saw her, she needed help
translation.ko: 그다음에 봤을 땐 도움이 필요해 보였어요

translation.en: because her son was calling for her to come.
translation.ko: 아들이 로레인한테 자기랑 같이 가자고 했대요

translation.en: And she says, "I don't wanna go with him." "I'm scared."
translation.ko: 로레인은 무섭다면서 아들과 가기 싫다고 했죠

translation.en: "I don't know what he's going to make me do."
And I have not seen her since that day, and I'm very concerned about her.
translation.ko: 그날 이후로 로레인을 못 봤고 괜찮은 건지 걱정돼요

translation.en: [Vicki] That's her.
[man] Hey, guys, that back door is open.
Sheriff's Department.
If you're in here, let yourself be known.
[man] Sheriff's Department. If you're in here,
let yourself be known.
[Vicki] My God, it smells like bleach.
You know, like if you poured bleach on something, it would turn white like that.
And why would you do that?
[woman] The light's on upstairs.
[man] I hate this shit.
[Vicki] Sheriff's Department!
Fuck me.
It's clear.
[Vicki] You know, that's weird.
What is that?
This new board.
Yeah, this is really weird. 'Cause it's screwed in.
[woman] Hey, we got out here. The house is empty,
but there's a room in the garage that's bolted shut.
translation.ko: 그런데 차고에 빗장을 박은 방이 하나 있거든

translation.en: And there's a strong smell of bleach.
We'll need a search warrant to get in there.
Okay.
[man] What in the world is behind that door?
-[dark music playing] -[indistinct police radio chatter]
[Vicki] I've been a cop for 22 years.
I started in Kansas.
Then I moved to South Carolina.
I used to work in Major Crimes.
But I just transferred to Missing Persons.
I'm used to working cases where there's a body.
I've worked murders, kidnappings.
Nothing really surprises me.
But the idea that you can save someone before they come to harm?
translation.ko: 그런데 누군가가 다치기 전에 구할 수 있다면요?

translation.en: That's why I want to work Missing Persons.
It's a busy unit. I work adults.
translation.ko: 바쁜 곳이에요 전 성인 실종을 담당하고

translation.en: Do you remember what your daughter was wearing that day?
[Vicki] We have J.P. who works missing juveniles.
[J.P.] 'Cause it would be helpful if you…
[Vicki] There are other investigators and victims' advocates who help us out.
translation.ko: 다른 수사관들과 피해자 지원팀도 함께 일해요

translation.en: Our sergeant is Nina,
and our unit is headed up by our captain Heidi.
She pours her heart into these cases.
In this unit, there's a chance you can save a life.
translation.ko: 이 팀에선 생명을 구할 기회가 있습니다

translation.en: And there's nothing more rewarding than saving a life.
translation.ko: 생명을 구하는 것만큼 값진 보상은 없죠

translation.en: [Heidi] All right, we got a few important cases that are concerning right now.
translation.ko: 현재 긴급한 사건 몇 건이 진행되고 있는데

translation.en: So thank you all for being willing to help.
The one that I'm really concerned about is the Lorraine Garcia case,
translation.ko: 매우 우려되는 사건이 로레인 가르시아 건인데

translation.en: the 61-year-old woman.
We were at the house last night and there were some things that were concerning.
translation.ko: 어젯밤에 그 집에 가봤는데 심상치 않은 점들이 있었어요

translation.en: Vicki? [Vicki] She's actually been missing for two months.
translation.ko: - 비키? - 사실 두 달 전에 실종됐어요

translation.en: The last person to see her was her neighbor,
and that was on September 13th. She hasn't been seen since.
translation.ko: 그게 9월 13일이었고 그 후로 행방을 알 수 없어요

translation.en: -Okay. What about the son? -[Vicki] We're trying to locate him.
He doesn't have a number where we can get in touch with him.
translation.ko: 연락할 수 있는 전화번호가 없는 상태예요

translation.en: He was previously in the military,
and we do know that he has a history of violence.
translation.ko: 폭행 전력이 있는 걸로 알고 있습니다

translation.en: [Heidi] Did you get in touch with the ex-daughter-in-law?
I called her. I need to call her back again.
She had some information,
but she said that she was gonna find out some more.
translation.ko: 자기가 더 알아본 뒤에 얘기하겠다고 했어요

translation.en: So strange that a daughter-in-law who lives in another state
translation.ko: 너무 이상한 점이 다른 주에 사는 며느리가 실종 신고를 했단 점이야

translation.en: would be the one that's calling to make this report, not her own son.
translation.ko: 다른 주에 사는 며느리가 실종 신고를 했단 점이야 아들이 아니라

translation.en: -[phone line ringing] -[woman on phone] Hello?
This is Investigator Rains with Richland County Sheriff's Department. How are you?
translation.ko: 리칠랜드 카운티 보안관서 레인스 수사관이에요, 안녕하세요?

translation.en: [woman] I'm doing just fine, how about yourself?
Um, I'm doing good.
I'm looking at the report with Lorraine Garcia.
translation.ko: 로레인 가르시아 실종 신고서를 보고 있는데요

translation.en: [woman] Yes.
When is the last time that you talked to her?
[woman] I last spoke to her…
on the phone sometime in the beginning of September.
We used to talk all the time, and then I didn't hear from her.
translation.ko: 수시로 통화했는데 그 뒤로 소식이 끊겼죠

translation.en: And the son, is that the one that was living with her? Anthony?
-[woman] Anthony Garcia, yes. -Okay.
-And that's your ex-husband? -That's my ex-husband.
Okay.
Is Tony still around, you know, out at the address?
translation.ko: 토니는 지금도 그 주소지에 살고 있나요?

translation.en: [woman] He was living there. That was the last address I had for him.
translation.ko: 거기 살았어요 제가 아는 주소지는 거기고요

translation.en: Okay.
When you talked to her then, what was she saying?
[woman] She was saying that she was scared of him.
Okay.
Do you think he may have done something to her?
[woman] I'm afraid of that.
I can't say for sure because he's really got a temper.
translation.ko: 확신할 순 없지만 토니 성질이 진짜 불같거든요

translation.en: And he's unpredictable.
[woman] The last time I talked to her was on the phone.
She seemed very paranoid, like she couldn't talk much on the phone.
Like, you know, maybe people were listening to her.
translation.ko: "러맨다 캔디스 무어 이전 며느리" 마치 누가 듣는 것처럼요

translation.en: And then it was like she vanished without a trace.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 흔적도 없이 사라진 거죠

translation.en: I said, "I gotta call the police."
"I need to report her missing." "I need to find out where she is."
translation.ko: 실종 신고를 해서 어디 있는지 알아야겠다고요

translation.en: Tony's scary, um, bottom line.
translation.ko: 토니는 무서워요 달리 할 말이 없죠

translation.en: She was afraid of him.
And she let me know that she was scared of him.
There's like a level of sociopathy.
When he does something
translation.ko: 토니는 남들이 몰랐으면 하는 일을 할 땐

translation.en: that he doesn't want people to know about, his first gut reaction is to cover it up.
translation.ko: 토니는 남들이 몰랐으면 하는 일을 할 땐 본능적으로 그걸 감추려고 하죠

translation.en: And that's the kind of person that he is.
[Vicki] They signed the warrant for the room in the house.
Okay. Good.
[Vicki] They were like, "You think he's holding her hostage
translation.ko: 이런 식이었죠 '인질로 가뒀을까요? 더한 짓을 했을까요?'

translation.en: or you think he did something worse?"
[officer] All right, I'm heading that way.
[officer] Hey, Vicki.
About halfway afraid to open that.
-[Vicki] All right, you ready? -[officer] Yeah.
[Vicki] Wait a minute.
Gonna get my flashlight on.
-[officer sighs] -[Vicki] All right, let's go.
[officer] Okay, thank God. It's just a storage room.
Wonder what's in all these boxes and bags.
[Vicki] Wonder what that is.
[officer] Well, there's paperwork.
Maybe that's her bank account?
[Vicki] We can follow up on that.
See all these holes?
Maybe where a fist went. The knuckle marks.
translation.ko: 주먹으로 친 거 같죠? 주먹 자국도 있네요

translation.en: [Vicki] Why does all the doors have string on them?
How bizarre.
I think that this was her room.
It opens to the inside, but look where it's screwed.
translation.ko: 안쪽으로 열리는데 나사 박힌 거 봐요

translation.en: -Multiple times. -Yeah. Definitely.
Maybe she was locked in here.
My God, it smells like bleach, and it's… [officer gags]
[Vicki] Why does the carpet need to be out of her bedroom
and not any other bedrooms in the house?
[officer] Something electronic.
[Vicki] Could be her cell phone?
Oh, that bothers me, right there.
You know, that is actually the cell phone.
[Vicki] Why would you burn the cell phone?
[officer] Cell phones store content.
So what was on the content that caused someone to want to burn it and try to destroy it?
translation.ko: 어떤 콘텐츠가 있길래 태워서 없애려고 했을까요?

translation.en: [radio host] This is 101.3 The Big DM. There's the sunrise.
You know it's gonna be a great day in the neighborhood.
Do something for somebody, but make sure you do something special for yourself too.
translation.ko: 다른 사람에게, 또 자신에게도 특별한 뭔가를 해보세요

translation.en: It's time to get busy. This is 101.3…
[Vicki] When I was young,
my mom wanted me to go into nursing.
But I wanted to be a police officer.
I still wanted to help people.
But I loved the idea of solving mysteries.
My mom didn't think it was safe.
She was like, "Girls can't do that."
My dad said,
"If that's what's in your heart, then you should definitely go do it."
translation.ko: 그게 제가 원하는 일이라면 무조건 하라셨어요

translation.en: "Treat people fair, treat people right, and be safe."
"But be very careful. There are bad people out there."
[Vicki] This is Investigator Rains.
[man on phone] Somebody told me that…
That you were looking for my mom.
Mr. Garcia?
[Anthony] Yes?
[Vicki] When is the last time you saw your mom?
[Anthony] The hospital was the last person to see my mom. Like…
translation.ko: 엄마를 마지막으로 본 건 병원 사람들이에요

translation.en: [Vicki] So you took her to the hospital?
[Anthony] Prisma Health.
[Vicki] What was the problem that--
[Anthony] Oh, I just needed her to take her medicine!
You took her to Prisma to make them give her her medicine?
[Anthony] Then I tried to find out where she was. And nobody didn't know where she was.
translation.ko: 나중에 다시 찾으러 갔는데 아무도 어디 있는지 몰랐어요

translation.en: Do you know if your mom has a cell phone?
[Anthony] Uh, yes.
[Vicki] Do you know where her cell phone's at?
-Is it in a burn barrel in the backyard? -Exactly.
[Anthony] Um… I don't know.
But I could look.
You could look where?
[Anthony] In the array of stuff.
[Vicki] Mr. Garcia, your mom is missing.
Is there a reason you didn't file a police report,
if you're worried and you're trying to find her?
[Anthony] I feel like… like you're interrogating me. Like I'm the number-one suspect.
translation.ko: 내가 무슨 유력 용의자인 것처럼 취조하는 느낌이네요

translation.en: These questions are really important for us to find your mom.
translation.ko: 어머니를 찾는 데 매우 중요한 질문들이에요

translation.en: Mr. Garcia, can you come in right now?
translation.ko: 가르시아 씨 지금 서로 올 수 있나요?

translation.en: Do I need to bring a lawyer?
I mean, you're not under arrest or anything. I'm just trying to find your mom. [laughs]
translation.ko: 체포된 것도 아니고 당신 어머니를 찾으려는 건데요

translation.en: [Anthony] She's somewhere. I'm not saying…
She's alive. I know she's alive. She's…
She's alive. I know she is. Ain't no way.
He hung up.
I'm gonna go ahead and head down there.
[Heidi] I've been Captain of Missing Persons Unit for the last five years.
translation.ko: 실종 수사팀 팀장으로 재직한 지 5년 됐어요

translation.en: The most unsettling thing is when someone is missing
translation.ko: 가장 마음이 안 좋은 건 누군가가 실종됐는데 위험에 처했을지도 모른다는 거예요

translation.en: and I think they might be in danger.
I think about it non-stop.
I think about that person when I'm driving home,
translation.ko: 차 몰고 퇴근할 때도 실종자를 생각하고

translation.en: when I'm eating, when I'm brushing my teeth at night,
translation.ko: 밥 먹을 때나 자기 전에 양치할 때도

translation.en: when I'm laying down trying to go to sleep.
Their life could be dependent on you finding them.
translation.ko: 그들의 목숨이 우리 수사에 달렸을 수 있잖아요

translation.en: Every hour could be critically important.
It's like an obsession.
-[Vicki on phone] Yes, ma'am. -Vicki, he's out here.
translation.ko: 네, 팀장님 - 비키, 그자가 여기 왔어 - 네?

translation.en: -[Vicki] What? -I think that's his truck back behind me.
translation.ko: - 비키, 그자가 여기 왔어 - 네? 내 뒤에 있는 게 그 사람 트럭 같아

translation.en: Is it a red truck?
Yeah, he's out here.
[Vicki] His license is suspended, so he shouldn't be driving his truck.
translation.ko: 면허 정지라 트럭 몰면 안 되는데요

translation.en: He's totally on the phone looking at me now, but he's behind the neighbor's house.
translation.ko: 날 보면서 누구랑 통화하는데 지금 옆집 뒤쪽에 있어

translation.en: [Vicki] Oh my gosh. Okay.
There's a reason he didn't come here 'cause there's nothing inside that house.
translation.ko: 서로 안 온 이유가 있네요 집 안에는 뭐가 없으니까요

translation.en: Fuck.
-That… Wait, the carpet, it's gone. -[Vicki] I'll be right there.
The carpet's gone?
Oh, the carpet's gone.
Oh my God.
[Heidi on phone] Yeah, head this way as quick as you can.
[Heidi] That's him.
He is freaking me out.
[Vicki] Can you walk over here with me?
-Just walk straight up to the driveway. -[dog barking]
[Anthony] You got a whole squad with you?
Do you gotta stay on the phone? This is kinda important.
[Anthony] Y'all think I want to be a statistic on CNN?
-[Vicki] Do you have any weapons on you? -No, ma'am.
[Vicki] I just wanna make sure.
[Anthony] Can I keep breathing?
-[Heidi] Can you what? -Can I live to see another day?
[Heidi] Yeah. Yeah.
[Anthony] Officers come here with their hands on their pistol.
[Heidi] This is about your mom's missing.
[Vicki] Mr. Garcia, look at me, please.
Why did you come out here and start moving trash instead of coming and talking to me?
translation.ko: 왜 나랑 얘기하러 안 오고 여기서 쓰레기를 치우고 있죠?

translation.en: [Anthony] No, no, no. I did not even know you was looking for me.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 그게 아니고 날 찾고 있는지 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Vicki] Can you show me where your mom stayed at in the house?
-[Anthony] Her bedroom? -[Vicki] Yeah, wherever she stayed.
-[Anthony] In the living room. -[Vicki] Okay.
Did she sleep in the living room?
[Anthony] Yes, ma'am.
[Heidi] What did she sleep on when she was in here?
[Anthony] The air mattress.
[Vicki] Why does all the doors have string on them?
[Anthony] That would definitely not hold my mama back. She's strong.
translation.ko: 줄도 소용없었을 거예요 엄마 힘이 장사라

translation.en: [Vicki] Where do you think your mom is?
[Anthony] Probably with… some guy.
[Vicki] Can I get the name of the guys that she's been dating?
[Anthony] The last person she dated was… Albert.
No, hold on, hold on, hold on. Uh-uh.
Theodore Roosevelt.
Listen. You don't want us to help you find your mom?
translation.ko: 가르시아 씨 어머니 찾고 싶지 않아요?

translation.en: [Anthony] To… Um, she ran away from the house.
[Vicki] Who is this?
[Anthony] That's my mama.
[Vicki] So why would a picture of your mom be out here in the trash?
translation.ko: 왜 어머니 사진이 쓰레기 속에 있어요?

translation.en: Would that not be a picture you'd want to keep?
This looks like a lot of pictures, actually.
Are these things not important?
Why did you not report your mom missing?
translation.ko: 어머니가 실종된 걸 왜 신고하지 않았죠?

translation.en: [Anthony] My… ex-wife did.
No, I'm asking you why you didn't.
[Anthony] 'Cause I didn't.
[Vicki] You're not under arrest, but we do need to speak with you at headquarters.
translation.ko: 체포하는 건 아니지만 서로 가서 얘기 좀 하죠

translation.en: And we're taking your truck.
[officer] Watch your knee, okay? I don't want to get your knee.
[Heidi] I hate mysteries.
I don't like board games that are mysteries.
translation.ko: 미스터리 보드게임 미스터리 영화 다 싫고

translation.en: I don't like movies that are mysteries, books that are mysteries.
translation.ko: 미스터리 보드게임 미스터리 영화 다 싫고 책도 미스터리한 건 다 싫어요

translation.en: I hate 'em all.
We do this in real life every day, and it's not a game.
translation.ko: 현실에서 매일 미스터리를 다루는데 이건 게임이 아니죠

translation.en: These are not just cases. They're people.
translation.ko: 이건 그냥 사건이 아니라 목숨이 달린 일이에요

translation.en: Maybe they just want to disappear.
Then again, it could be somebody did something to them.
translation.ko: 하지만 누군가가 위해를 가했을 수도 있어요

translation.en: Over the years, I've learned that you never know
translation.ko: 그동안 일하며 배운 게 있다면 일이 어떤 방향으로 흘러갈지 알 수 없단 거예요

translation.en: what direction things are gonna go.
translation.ko: 일이 어떤 방향으로 흘러갈지 알 수 없단 거예요

translation.en: It's normal for your mind to go one particular place to start with,
translation.ko: 흔히 처음엔 생각이 특정한 방향으로 가지만

translation.en: but you can't allow your mind to stay there.
Because that's when you're gonna go wrong.
That's when you're gonna miss something that's really important,
and possibly fail at either finding someone
or not finding them fast enough that you could have saved them.
translation.ko: 실종자를 찾아 구하는 데 늦을 수도 있어요

translation.en: [Vicki] I need you to give a statement about the last time you saw your mother.
translation.ko: 어머니와 마지막에 있던 일을 진술해 주시죠

translation.en: [officer] So what happened that night?
[Anthony] She was off her meds.
She has to be on her meds.
[officer] For what?
[Anthony] She gets paranoid and then she, like…
starts talking about people out to get her,
and she wants to give up on everything.
[sighs] I said, "Mom, if you don't get on your medication,
I'm gonna take you somewhere where they're gonna make you."
But she's thinking like I'm… "What you mean, make me?"
Oh God, here we go.
[officer] So she had a bunch of issues.
[Anthony] A bunch of issues. Sometimes she seemed sane,
and then other times it's like, "Oh, what's going on, Mama?"
translation.ko: 어느 순간 정신이 나가서 '왜 그래요, 엄마?' 하죠

translation.en: [Nina] Right, so I got the medical records from the hospital. He did drop her off.
translation.ko: 병원에서 진료 기록을 가져왔는데 정말 모셔 갔더라고요

translation.en: [Heidi] Was there a medical reason for her to be there?
No. His reason was, "She needs to be back on her meds."
translation.ko: 아뇨, 약을 다시 먹어야 한다며 아들이 데려간 거죠

translation.en: She was on Prozac a while back,
but she didn't like what it was doing, and so she stopped taking that.
translation.ko: 효능이 잘 맞질 않아서 복용을 중단했어요

translation.en: The doctor said that she seemed very lucid.
"She's pleasant to talk to."
"Doesn't have any hallucinations or delusions."
And it says, this is interesting,
"When I ask the patient if she feels safe in her home with her son,
translation.ko: '아들과 집에 있을 때 안전하다고 느껴지는지 물으니'

translation.en: she replied, 'I'll take the Fifth.'"
"Patient does not have a cell phone and states she went to her neighbor's house
translation.ko: '환자에게 휴대폰이 없음 이웃집에 가서 전화를 빌려'

translation.en: to ask them to call the bank to restrict any access."
[Heidi] Oh, look at that. She's worried he's trying to make her out to be crazy.
translation.ko: 그런 거네, 아들이 자신을 미친 것처럼 보이게 해서

translation.en: -[Nina] Mm-hmm. Yup. -And get some money.
"I informed her that she would have to make a police report, and she cannot stay in the hospital."
translation.ko: '환자에게 경찰에 신고할 것과 퇴원할 것을 권고함'

translation.en: [Heidi] Somebody who is really a victim of crime is gonna stand there and say, you know,
translation.ko: 정말 어떤 범죄의 피해자라면 이런 말들을 하겠지

translation.en: "They locked me in my room." "They won't give me food and water."
translation.ko: '그들이 날 방에 가뒀어요 음식이랑 물도 안 줘요'

translation.en: "They're trying to sell my house." "They're taking my cell phone."
translation.ko: '내 집을 팔려고 해요 내 휴대폰을 뺏어 가요'

translation.en: -They're… Yeah. All of that sounds-- -[Nina] All of it. Yes.
Stuff would sound the same as somebody who was paranoid.
translation.ko: 편집증 있는 사람이 하는 말과 비슷하거든

translation.en: Tells everyone, to all the doctors, saying she doesn't want to go home, she doesn't want to go home.
translation.ko: 로레인은 모든 사람을 붙잡고 집에 가기 싫다고 했어요

translation.en: So they placed her in the lobby.
[Heidi] But did she go back to the house?
I mean, I don't know.
[Anthony] Went into the hospital, Prisma Health. I went in there.
translation.ko: 프리스마 헬스 병원으로 갔죠 거기 들어가서

translation.en: Tried to specify, "I just want y'all to get her on her medication."
translation.ko: 최대한 명확하게 말했어요 '엄마가 약 드시게 해 주세요'

translation.en: "That's all I want y'all to do. I'm… not trying to put her in here."
They put her in inpatient anyway.
By the time I get back to Prisma Health and I try to find my mom,
translation.ko: 다음에 다시 병원에 가서 엄마를 찾으니까

translation.en: it's like, "Oh, she signed out on her own recognizance."
I'm like, "What in the world? So where's she at?"
"She signed out and left."
It's like they erased her off the books and let her go free.
translation.ko: 흔적도 안 남기고 내보낸 거 같았다니까요

translation.en: [officer] A couple days go by when she's in the hospital?
[Anthony] Four, five, six days?
[officer] So since she went to the hospital, you've never seen her again?
translation.ko: 병원에 입원하신 뒤로 한 번도 못 본 거네요?

translation.en: [Anthony] No.
[Lamanda] I met Tony back in 2004.
He was getting ready to go into the military.
He was happy-go-lucky.
He never met a stranger. Everyone immediately became his friend.
translation.ko: 모르는 사람을 만나도 금세 친해질 정도로 살가웠어요

translation.en: He was in Iraq for two and a half, three years.
They used him to kick in the doors, when they'd go in and clear buildings.
translation.ko: 토니가 선발대로 문을 따면 다들 들어가 소탕하는 식이었죠

translation.en: While stationed over there, they were… Their Stryker was hit with an IED.
translation.ko: 거기 주둔해 있을 때 장갑차가 사제폭탄에 맞았어요

translation.en: When Tony came back from Iraq, it was just a wild look in his eyes.
translation.ko: 이라크에서 돌아왔을 때 토니 눈빛이 달라져 있었어요

translation.en: He had seen a lot of things, and he couldn't go a day without drinking.
translation.ko: 많은 걸 목격한 탓에 술 없이는 하루도 못 견뎠죠

translation.en: Paranoia set in. You know, he wasn't sure of everybody's motives.
translation.ko: 편집증이 나타나기 시작했고 사람들의 의도를 의심했어요

translation.en: The first time I realized he had PTSD, it was New Year's Eve,
translation.ko: 처음으로 PTSD 증세를 보인 건 새해 전야였어요

translation.en: and he was… we were in the house.
And of course, people were outside popping off fireworks.
And he got up, and he turned off every light in the house.
translation.ko: 토니는 벌떡 일어나 집 안의 불을 다 끄고는

translation.en: And he made me sit down, and he told me to "Shh."
And then he grabbed a knife out of the kitchen, and then he just stood by the door.
translation.ko: 그러고는 주방에서 칼을 집어 문가에 가서 섰어요

translation.en: We sat there quiet like that for at least ten minutes,
before I was like, "You know nobody's coming in here, right?"
translation.ko: 제가 말했죠 '아무도 안 들어오는 거 알지?'

translation.en: [Lamanda] I know firsthand…
[sighs] …how scary it can get.
The violence that can go too far.
translation.ko: 감당 못 할 폭력이 어떤 건지

translation.en: So do I think he could have done something to his mom?
Yes. I do.
[Vicki] The burn barrel that's in the backyard, did you ever burn anything in there?
translation.ko: 뒷마당에 소각용 통이 있던데 거기에 뭘 태웠나요?

translation.en: [Anthony] Not that I can recall.
All this stuff out there in the back?
There was so much more stuff in that house. It's been, like, in storage facilities.
translation.ko: 집에 물건이 너무 많아서 무슨 창고 시설 같았어요

translation.en: [Vicki] When did you start taking stuff out of the house to put in storage?
translation.ko: 임대 창고에 넣으려고 물건을 뺀 게 언제부터죠?

translation.en: [Anthony] This past week.
[Vicki] This past week? Okay.
[Heidi] Are we in your way or anything? Where are you trying to go?
translation.ko: 우리가 길을 막고 있나요? 어디 가시죠?

translation.en: -[man] Right there. -[Heidi] What are you supposed to do?
[man] Put carpet in one room.
You're gonna go to the house to put carpet in?
[man] Yes, ma'am. Yeah. Who hired you guys?
[man] Well, the guy, I think he's buying the house.
Okay.
Did he already buy the house?
[man] Well, he gave a deposit for it, $2,500.
What did he do? Oh, he paid for the carpet?
No, for the deposit on the house.
[Heidi] Oh, he paid $2,500 for the deposit on the house. Gotcha.
How did he advertise the house?
[man] Facebook… market?
Facebook Marketplace?
[Heidi] Oh, okay. Do you have that ad, by chance?
translation.ko: 아, 알았어요 혹시 그 광고 갖고 있나요? 볼 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Can you pull that up?
translation.ko: 혹시 그 광고 갖고 있나요? 볼 수 있을까요?

translation.en: [officer] Can I see it?
Wait, hold on. I'll take a picture of it.
[Heidi] Who signed the paperwork? Oh, Anthony signed the paperwork? Okay.
translation.ko: 누가 계약서에 서명했나요? - 앤서니가 했어요? 알았어요 - 앤서니요

translation.en: [man] Anthony. Mm-hmm.
As of right now, this house is not for sale.
So, I mean, as far as you doing any kind of work in there, not gonna happen.
translation.ko: 따라서 무슨 일을 하러 왔든 지금은 안 돼요

translation.en: I'll drive my car around and come back.
Yeah. All right.
[Vicki] Hey, I just got your message.
So, somebody showed up and already owns the house or something?
translation.ko: 누가 현장에 왔는데 그 집이 이미 팔렸다고요?

translation.en: It's a direct sale from Anthony to someone else for…
He already put down the $2,500 deposit.
Wow. Okay.
It's not a legal contract, but yeah, he already sold it by owner.
translation.ko: 법적 효력은 없지만 집주인인 척 집을 판 거야

translation.en: I sent you a picture of the Marketplace ad.
This guy's paid $2,500 cash,
and was gonna pay $300 a month until it was paid off.
-[Vicki] Wow. Okay. -Yeah.
translation.ko: 매달 300달러를 지불해 잔금을 치르는 형식이야 - 그래 - 네

translation.en: And he was sending someone over to go ahead
and put the carpet in one room,
so the guy has carpet in his van too.
translation.ko: 그 사람 차에 카펫이 실려 있었어

translation.en: That's crazy. All right. I'm gonna go in there and question him about that.
translation.ko: 기가 막히네요 가서 이 부분을 물어볼게요

translation.en: Can you help me get in touch with this guy?
translation.ko: 이 사람한테 연락해 줄래요? 페이스북에서 대화했던데

translation.en: They're talking back and forth on Facebook
translation.ko: 이 사람한테 연락해 줄래요? 페이스북에서 대화했던데 "디나 러빈 피해자 지원팀"

translation.en: because he bought the house on Facebook Marketplace.
translation.ko: 페이스북 마켓플레이스에서 그 집을 산 사람이에요

translation.en: But when Heidi was taking the pictures,
it cut off the top of the conversation.
I imagine he said, "Why are you selling your house?"
translation.ko: 집을 왜 파는지 물었던 거 같아요

translation.en: -But can you ask him that? -Yeah, let me call him now.
translation.ko: - 한번 확인해 줄래요? - 네, 바로 전화할게요

translation.en: [Vicki] I've worked a lot of major crimes, including homicides, for over 20 years.
translation.ko: 전 20년 넘게 살인을 포함해 많은 강력 범죄를 다뤘어요

translation.en: You learn to expect to be lied to,
but you develop an instinct to know when it's happening.
translation.ko: 그게 언제인지 알아채는 직감을 기르게 되죠

translation.en: Things just don't feel right.
That's when you need to start asking direct questions.
Because liars haven't worked out all the answers.
translation.ko: 아직 모든 변명을 구축하지 않은 상태라

translation.en: Their stories begin to fall apart.
And you know they're hiding something big.
translation.ko: 그럼 뭔가 중요한 걸 숨기고 있단 뜻이죠

translation.en: I just got a couple questions for you.
Are you comfortable like that?
[Anthony] It's my back.
[Vicki] Okay. Some guy just showed up out there saying that he…
translation.ko: 알았어요 방금 누가 집에 나타나 말하길

translation.en: that he bought the house, and that he's paid you money for a bit.
translation.ko: 자기가 그 집을 샀고 돈을 지불했다더군요

translation.en: [Anthony] Rent to own.
[Vicki] The problem with selling the house is it's in your mom's name.
translation.ko: 문제는 집의 소유주가 어머니로 되어있단 거예요

translation.en: And… are you listening to me?
[Anthony] Yes, ma'am. I'm sorry.
[Vicki] Okay. And you don't have power of attorney, right?
Right?
-Mr. Garcia? -[Anthony] I'm listening.
[Vicki] I know, but I asked you a question.
All right, I need you to look at me. You're not even looking at me.
[Anthony] Yes, ma'am. I'm sorry.
I told him it's in my mama's name.
When I get power of attorney…
power of attorney to…
She's not in her right mind.
[Vicki] Right, but how can you file when your mom is not here to sign?
translation.ko: 어머니가 안 계셔서 서명을 못 하는데 무슨 수로요?

translation.en: -She wanted to sell it. -[Vicki] Who's she?
Lorraine M. Garcia.
[Vicki] Right, but she didn't sell it, 'cause she went missing, right?
translation.ko: 네, 근데 실종돼서 그 집을 안 팔았잖아요

translation.en: -Okay. -[Vicki] Is that correct?
She didn't sell it, 'cause she went missing?
translation.ko: 로레인은 실종돼서 그 집을 안 팔았나요?

translation.en: -[Anthony] Yes. -[Vicki] Okay.
So why are you not looking for your mother?
Why are you selling her house instead of looking for her?
translation.ko: 왜 어머니는 안 찾고 어머니 집을 팔았어요?

translation.en: I'll be back.
[in Spanish] Okay, and do you still have that message?
[man on phone] Yes, I saved it.
[in English] He said the person that translated everything to him…
translation.ko: 그때 자기한테 번역해 준 사람 말로는

translation.en: He said that it sounded like they said somebody died there.
translation.ko: 거기서 누가 죽었다고 하는 거 같았대요

translation.en: [Vicki] Oh my.
[in Spanish] Is there any way you can send it to me as a message
translation.ko: 그걸 저한테 메시지로 보내주실 수 있나요?

translation.en: to the number I gave you yesterday?
[man] Yes, I can send it to you right now.
[Deena in English] Okay. Gracias.
[Vicki] Wow. "Just recently passed."
"When would you like to come see the house?"
So, who is he saying just passed?
[woman] The day she disappeared was the last day I saw her.
translation.ko: 로레인이 사라진 날 마지막으로 로레인을 봤어요

translation.en: In the past, Lorraine told me
that Tony had never threatened her directly,
and it was worse this time than it had been before.
translation.ko: 그런데 이번엔 그 어느 때보다 심각했던 거죠

translation.en: The day she disappeared, she was telling me
that he had taken her to a lawyer's office.
He told her that she was going to sell the house.
And she told him she didn't want to sell the house.
And she said Tony grabbed her arm and told her,
translation.ko: 그랬더니 토니가 자기 팔을 잡고 말하길

translation.en: "Mama, do you realize how easy it'd be to push you down these steps and kill you?"
translation.ko: '엄마를 계단에서 밀쳐서 죽이는 건 식은 죽 먹기예요'

translation.en: "You will do what I tell you to do."
[Vicki] Do you and your mom ever argue?
[Anthony] All the time. Like we're married.
[Vicki] Does it ever turn physical?
[Anthony] I don't know what to do.
[Vicki] I don't know. People do crazy things.
translation.ko: 사람은 말도 안 되는 일도 해요

translation.en: Sometimes they do things, and then they regret what they did.
translation.ko: 때로 뭔가를 저지르고 나중에 후회하기도 하죠

translation.en: Or say you're arguing with somebody, and you push them, and they fall, and hit their head, and die.
translation.ko: 가령 누구랑 말다툼하다 밀쳐서 추락사했다고 쳐요

translation.en: And you hide the body because you don't want to go to prison for an accident.
translation.ko: 사고였는데 감옥 가기 싫어서 그 시신을 숨기는 거죠

translation.en: You think I had somethin' to do with my mama.
[Vicki] No. I'm hoping your mom is fine and we find her.
What I'm trying to ask you are just facts. Why are--
translation.ko: 난 사실에 관해 묻는 거예요 어째서…

translation.en: [Anthony] You're trying to insinuate I did something with my mother…
[Vicki] No, I'm not trying to insinuate.
[Anthony] …to sell the house. That's ludicrous.
Y'all know I don't have to talk to y'all. I know my amendment rights, right?
translation.ko: 내가 말할 필요는 없죠 나도 내 권리는 알아요

translation.en: It's my legal right not to say a motherfuckin' word.
translation.ko: 헌법상 아무 말도 안 해도 되잖아요

translation.en: [Vicki] If you can think of anything that would help us find your mom, let us know.
translation.ko: 어머니 찾는 데 도움이 될 만한 게 있으면 연락하세요

translation.en: [Anthony] Vicki Rains, Richland County cop.
translation.ko: 비키 레인스 리칠랜드 카운티 경찰 말이에요

translation.en: She was so slick with it.
I did not see this woman coming at all. She's like a shark born swimming.
translation.ko: 그 여자가 오는 줄도 몰랐어요 물속을 가르는 상어 같아서

translation.en: She acted like it was all cool.
It was like,
"No one's accusing you."
No, you guys…
accused me.
Even though I know you ain't say that, "Did you kill your mom?"
translation.ko: 물론 이런 말은 안 했죠 '네가 엄마를 죽였냐?'

translation.en: You ain't say that, but that don't mean you didn't… insinuate.
translation.ko: 그 말은 안 했지만 그걸 암시하기는 했다고요

translation.en: When soldiers go to war,
they go to war heroes, but come back monsters.
I went to Iraq.
My innocence is gone because…
I was a part of that shit.
But what really pisses me off? All my motherfucking respect.
translation.ko: 뭐가 제일 화나는지 알아요? 내 모든 망할 존중심

translation.en: All that motherfucking blood, sweat, and tears?
All that shit's over there. I come here? It don't mean shit.
translation.ko: 그 모든 건 거기 있지 여기선 아무것도 아니란 거예요

translation.en: The police, the military, God, the devil. I don't give a fuck.
translation.ko: 경찰, 군대, 신, 악마 다 상관없어요

translation.en: We will all pay for our sins. [chuckles] Just like I'll pay for mine.
translation.ko: 우린 다 죗값을 치르죠 나도 내 죗값 치를 거고요

translation.en: So let's just gun it out or y'all just shoot me in the head.
translation.ko: 그러니까 빨리 끝내든가 내 머리를 쏴요

translation.en: Let's just get this shit over with.
I refuse to go quietly into that good night, man.
I refuse.
[preacher] Abraham did not get caught up in all of the turmoil around him.
translation.ko: 아브라함은 자신에게 주어진 온갖 고난에 굴하지 않았어요

translation.en: He said, "I will follow the one who is in front of me
translation.ko: 그는 말합니다 '내 앞에 계신 분을 따르리라'

translation.en: who has given me his word."
If you're gonna run the race of life for God, it will cost you.
translation.ko: 하나님을 위한 삶을 사는 사람에겐 반드시 시험이 닥칩니다

translation.en: [Vicki] I believe there's good and evil in the world.
translation.ko: 전 세상에 선과 악이 있다고 믿어요

translation.en: But when it comes to crimes, I think it's way more complicated.
translation.ko: 하지만 범죄는 그렇게 딱 잘라 구분할 수 없죠

translation.en: [preacher] I know so many people that are so gifted.
They have so much potential,
but they allow bad habits and sinful desires to overtake them.
translation.ko: 나쁜 습관과 그릇된 욕망에 사로잡히기도 합니다

translation.en: [Vicki] I've worked Sex Crimes and Major Crimes for many years.
translation.ko: 전 성범죄와 강력 범죄를 오랫동안 다뤘어요

translation.en: Some people thrive on doing bad things.
translation.ko: 나쁜 짓을 하고도 잘만 사는 사람들이 있죠

translation.en: It's just who they are.
When we mess and play with the things that are outside of God's word,
translation.ko: 하나님의 말씀을 떠나 세상 것을 탐할 때는

translation.en: there is always a price to pay.
[Vicki] But I've learned a lot of times good people make bad decisions.
translation.ko: 그런데 선한 사람이 나쁜 결정을 하는 경우도 많아요

translation.en: A lot of it is environment, support they did or didn't have.
translation.ko: 대개는 자신이 누리거나 누리지 못한 환경 때문으로

translation.en: They're a victim of circumstances.
I think you need to have a certain level of understanding and empathy
translation.ko: 사람이라면 누구나 타인을 어느 정도 이해하고

translation.en: towards another human being.
But the sad truth is often the people who have been the most badly damaged
translation.ko: 그러나 슬픈 사실은 가장 깊은 상처를 입은 사람들이

translation.en: end up being the most dangerous.
translation.ko: 가장 위험한 존재가 되곤 한다는 겁니다

translation.en: [Heidi] So, we've got a missing person, and it's starting to look like a homicide.
translation.ko: 실종으로 접수된 사건인데 점차 살인이 의심되고 있어요

translation.en: Vicki, do you want to go ahead and brief everyone?
[Vicki] On the 18th of this month, Lamanda Garcia filed a missing person report
translation.ko: 이달 18일에 러맨다 가르시아가 실종 신고를 접수했습니다

translation.en: on her ex-mother-in-law Lorraine Garcia.
Usually they stay in close contact, but she hadn't heard from her at all.
translation.ko: 평소 연락을 자주 했는데 연락이 뚝 끊겼답니다

translation.en: When she asked her ex Tony about her,
he would never give her a straight answer of where his mom was.
translation.ko: 어머니가 어디 있는지 제대로 답해주지 않았고요

translation.en: She didn't really want to get involved in it because she was afraid of him herself.
translation.ko: 전남편이 두려워서 이 일에 연루되기 싫었답니다

translation.en: She's like, "Sometimes he just sees red."
He loses his temper, he punches holes in the wall,
which we saw out at the house.
translation.ko: 저희도 그 집에 갔을 때 봤죠

translation.en: So, she filed a missing person report.
Is there any documented history of abuse with the ex-wife or…
translation.ko: 전처를 폭행한 기록이 있나요? "케빈 아이젠하워드 강력반 경감"

translation.en: -Like, I'm talking police reports. -[Vicki] Right.
A lot of times she didn't report it because she was very scared of him.
translation.ko: 전남편이 너무 무서워서 대개는 신고하지 않았대요

translation.en: Damn.
Finally, she left, got the kids, and went back to North Carolina.
But she said when she was with the son,
translation.ko: 자신이 토니랑 살 때 토니가 자기 어머니를

translation.en: he was very abusive to his mom physically, mentally, every which way.
I asked him why he moved everything out of the house,
translation.ko: 어머니가 돌아오시면 그 집에서 살 텐데

translation.en: because if his mom's gonna come back, that's where she's gonna live.
translation.ko: 왜 물건들을 집 밖으로 꺼내 놨냐고 물었더니

translation.en: Um, he said, "No, no, no, I took everything important."
"Put all of that stuff in storage."
[Heidi] They locked the storage unit down last night,
figured out where the units were, and called the manager. So they're locked down.
translation.ko: 어느 창고인지 알아내 매니저한테 요청해서 봉쇄했죠

translation.en: Were you able to do any kind of research as far as financials or anything yet?
translation.ko: 재정 관련해서는 알아낼 수 있던 게 있나요?

translation.en: [Vicki] We found several All South bank statements
in the locked room we did a search warrant on,
but we haven't had a chance to call the bank yet.
[Kevin] We need to do that.
That'll give us at least roads to go down if it's been used.
translation.ko: 그 계좌가 사용됐다면 적어도 수사 방향은 나오겠죠

translation.en: [Vicki] If anything is getting taken out or anything like that.
-Or she's renting a room somewhere. -Right.
Well, get started on that stuff. See what we get. [sighs]
[woman on phone] All South Federal Credit Union, how can I help?
Hi, this is Investigator Rains with Richland County Sheriff's Department.
I have a missing person case.
And she has an All South bank account. She's been missing for a couple months.
translation.ko: 올사우스에 계좌가 하나 있어요 실종된 지 두어 달 됐고요

translation.en: I'm just wondering if there's any activity on that account.
translation.ko: 그 계좌에 변동이 있었는지 알고 싶어서요

translation.en: [woman] What's that person's name?
Her first name is Lorraine. L-o-r-r-a-i-n-e. Her last name is Garcia.
[woman] She's been missing how long?
[Vicki] Since the middle of September.
[woman] Let me see if I can pull something.
I have video of some activity.
[Vicki] Was it activity after the middle of September?
[woman] The 13th.
Wow, the same day he said he took her to the hospital.
[woman] I'm gonna send this to you quick. The video is of course still coming.
translation.ko: 당장 이걸 보내드릴게요 영상은 아직 전송 중이고요

translation.en: [Vicki] So she took out $500?
[woman] Yeah.
-Did it come through? -[Vicki] Let's see.
[officer] That's definitely Lorraine. That looks exactly like her.
[Vicki] Okay. Here's the video.
That's him.
[officer] Did he say he took her to the bank?
[Vicki] Nope, he said he took her straight to the hospital.
At no point did he ever, ever say anything about going to the bank.
translation.ko: 은행에 갔다는 얘기는 전혀 하지 않았지

translation.en: He's never even mentioned that money.
[officer] So that's the only money that was pulled?
translation.ko: 이때 말고는 돈이 인출된 적 없나요?

translation.en: [Vicki] This is the only time that it was used, right? On September 13th?
[woman on phone] For the time frame you were asking, yes.
-There's been nothing since then. -Yeah. Okay, yeah. Thank you so much.
translation.ko: 물어보신 시기에는 이때가 마지막 거래예요 알겠어요, 정말 고맙습니다

translation.en: So, this is the very last sighting of Lorraine.
After this, she disappears and never accesses her bank account again.
translation.ko: 여기서 나간 뒤 사라졌고 더는 계좌를 이용하지 않았어

translation.en: [officer] It doesn't look good.
So, this is a search warrant,
and it'll say in there we can get any and all video
translation.ko: 이쪽 창고 구역의 영상은 모두 열람 가능하다고 나와요

translation.en: related to these storage units, any access, stuff like that.
translation.ko: 이쪽 창고 구역의 영상은 모두 열람 가능하다고 나와요 관련 영상 전부요

translation.en: Can I see the video?
Let's see…
[man] There he is, right there.
See that thing he's pulling? How heavy that is?
translation.ko: 지금 잡아끄는 거 보여요? 얼마나 무거운지?

translation.en: [Vicki] What's so important that he has to get it out?
[Heidi] Hey, Vicki.
[Vicki on phone] Hey, I just wanted to update you.
I'm out here at the storage unit that Tony has.
Okay.
He's been moving stuff in and out of here the past few days.
-Oh. -If your mom is just missing,
why do you want that stuff out of your storage unit?
We've got a search warrant, so we're about to go check out the inside.
translation.ko: 수색 영장이 있어서 창고 안을 확인하려고요

translation.en: Well, I'm on the way to Tony's now.
[Vicki] Yes, ma'am?
[Heidi] There is a car parked in the backyard.
translation.ko: 뒷마당에 차가 한 대 서 있어

translation.en: Oh, really?
Oh, someone's definitely here. Red shirt.
translation.ko: 확실히 누가 있어 빨간 셔츠를 입었어

translation.en: [automated voice] Region Three. Region Two.
2106 to any Region Two unit.
[officer on radio] 2106.
[Heidi] This is that home where the lady's missing from,
and we suspect foul play.
And there's a car parked in their backyard.
translation.ko: 지금 뒷마당에 차가 한 대 서 있거든요

translation.en: Just didn't want to approach without someone else here
because of the potential for something to go wrong.
translation.ko: 지원 없이 접근하면 안 될 것 같네요

translation.en: [officer] 10-4.
[Heidi] She's coming out.
Who are you?
-Ma'am? -[Heidi] What's your name?
Shakayla Moran.
-[Heidi] Shakayla? Okay. -Yes, ma'am.
[Heidi] You guys stay together? You and Tony together?
-Mm-hmm. Yeah. -Okay.
How long have you known Tony?
[Shakayla] Um, since 2017.
-[Heidi] Okay. -Mm-hmm.
[Heidi] I was comin' by to see if you guys saw Lorraine yet? No, ma'am.
-[Heidi] You haven't seen her at all? -We seen the poster on the news.
translation.ko: - 전혀 못 봤어요? - 뉴스에서 본 게 다예요

translation.en: -But that was it. -[Heidi] Okay.
[Shakayla] Yes, ma'am. You haven't heard any news or…
[Heidi] Oh, you know, we're learning a little bit as we go every day.
translation.ko: - 매일 조금씩 알아가고 있어요 - 네, 다행이네요

translation.en: Okay, good, but she's… lookin' like she's alive, right?
[Heidi] Why would you say that?
-Because he's worried. -[Heidi] Mm-hmm.
He's like, "If they can't find her now with her picture all over the news…"
translation.ko: 뉴스마다 어머니 사진이 뜨는데 못 찾는다면서

translation.en: -Something is, he's… -Do you have anything in your pocket?
-No, just my phone charger. -[Heidi] Okay.
-[Heidi] I got my hands in my pockets too. -I'm sorry.
-[Heidi] Just 'cause I'm a police officer… -Yeah, that's why I said…
-[Heidi] I always have to ask that, right? -I apologize.
[Heidi] Where are all her things now?
She had, like, a couple clothes and stuff, like some bags of clothes.
[Heidi] And where are those?
Um, I think we actually threw them out.
Yes, ma'am.
[Heidi] How come?
She wasn't here. Like, we… We took it as, "Okay, she left."
translation.ko: 여기 없으니까요 우린 집을 나갔다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Because we weren't thinking that she was just gonna…
All this was gonna happen.
Would anyone have any reason to think Tony was abusive to her?
translation.ko: 토니가 어머니를 학대했다고 생각할 이유가 있을까요?

translation.en: No, ma'am.
Is there any reason that she would tell anyone that?
[Shakayla] I mean, I've heard her say some crazy things.
translation.ko: 로레인이 이상한 말 하는 건 들었어요

translation.en: She was saying people were walking in and out the house, people were breaking in.
translation.ko: 사람들이 집에 왔다 갔다 한다며 무단 침입이라고요

translation.en: She asleep at night,
translation.ko: 밤에 자고 있는데 누가 집에 들어왔다 나갔대서

translation.en: people were coming in the front door and going out the back door.
translation.ko: 밤에 자고 있는데 누가 집에 들어왔다 나갔대서 우리가 그랬죠 '로레인, 아무도 안 그래요'

translation.en: We were like, "Miss Lorraine, no one's doing it."
She would just be like, "People are trying to kill me."
The neighbors were talkin' about tying her up to the back of their truck, and drag her down the road.
translation.ko: 이웃들이 자길 트럭 뒤에 묶어서 끌고 갈 궁리를 한댔죠

translation.en: He hates it all. He says it's embarrassing
to have to be running after his mom, looking after her, and, like…
translation.ko: 엄마 찾으러 다녀야 하고 돌봐야 하는 모든 게

translation.en: It bothers him.
To look after his mom?
[Shakayla] He's tired of it, like. He's like, "I want to live my life."
translation.ko: 많이 지쳤거든요 자기 삶을 살고 싶어 해요

translation.en: Hey, this is Heidi.
I just wanted to let you know, I just talked to Shakayla.
I guess she's Tony's girlfriend.
And she told me some really interesting things
about the relationship between Tony and his mom Lorraine.
translation.ko: 토니와 어머니 로레인의 관계가 어땠는지 말해줬어

translation.en: She mentioned that Tony was getting really frustrated.
So, now I'm wondering if he might have snapped.
translation.ko: 그래서 토니가 폭주한 걸 아닐까 싶어

translation.en: [Vicki on phone] Holy cow.
[Vicki] We're gonna see if there's anything… anything out of place, anything just odd.
translation.ko: 뭐든 이상하다 싶은 거나 의심 가는 게 있는지 봐요

translation.en: Blue carpet right there, that came out of the house.
translation.ko: 그 집 밖에 있던 파란 카펫

translation.en: [Vicki] And why put that piece of carpet out, and put it in storage?
translation.ko: 왜 카펫의 저 부분을 잘라 창고에 넣었을까요?

translation.en: [Nina] An axe.
A shovel.
Smell of bleach.
-[officer] Yeah. -[Nina] Bleach.
[officer on phone] We're at the storage. Inside are pieces of carpet.
translation.ko: 창고 안에 들어왔는데 카펫 조각들이 있고

translation.en: And then there is also this cooler that has
liquid residue in the bottom that smells like bleach.
translation.ko: 내부의 액체 잔류물에서 표백제 냄새가 나요

translation.en: There's an axe, a sledgehammer.
-And a shovel and the carpet. -Shovels? You didn't say shovels.
translation.ko: - 삽과 카펫이 있어요 - 삽? 삽 얘긴 없었잖아

translation.en: -That does not sound good. -[officer] Right. No, it doesn't.
I think all of those items together
could paint a picture of something very bad.
translation.ko: 아주 안 좋은 상황을 그려낼 수 있어

translation.en: [Vicki] This is Tony's ex-wife.
Investigator Rains.
[Lamanda] He's calling me.
And, um, like, from different numbers, ranting and raving.
translation.ko: 여러 전화번호로 전화하고 고래고래 악을 쓰는데

translation.en: He's acting very suspicious.
He thinks that y'all are coming to pick him up.
[Vicki] Pick him up like…
-[Lamanda] Like arrest him for something. -Okay.
Does he say what?
-No, he doesn't say what for. -Okay.
translation.ko: - 아뇨, 이유는 말 안 했어요 - 알았어요

translation.en: He's like, "I don't know what they're gonna get me for."
I was like, "Did you do anything that would make them arrest you?"
translation.ko: 그래서 체포하러 올 짓을 했는지 물었더니

translation.en: "No, I didn't do anything! I didn't do anything!"
"Why do you think they're coming for you?" "I don't know!"
translation.ko: 근데 왜 잡으러 오냐고 했더니 모르겠대요

translation.en: I don't know if it's psychosis,
or if he's worried about something he's done,
translation.ko: 자기가 한 일을 걱정하는 건지는 몰라도

translation.en: that y'all are gonna make some kind of connection with.
[Vicki] What surprised me most when I first became a police officer
translation.ko: 경찰이 되고 나서 가장 놀라웠던 건

translation.en: was the level of violence that can take place inside of a family.
I've seen family do the worst things to each other.
translation.ko: 가족이 서로에게 끔찍한 짓을 한 걸 봐왔죠

translation.en: Cases where people have shot, stabbed, or brutally injured their own family members.
translation.ko: 자기 가족을 쏘거나 찌르고 무참히 폭행한 사건들을요

translation.en: Back then, even though it bothered me, it was, um…
translation.ko: 그 당시엔 그런 게 마음은 불편하더라도

translation.en: maybe easier to let go.
But you don't realize that it's eventually gonna take a toll on you.
translation.ko: 그런데 알게 모르게 그게 마음에 짐이 되더라고요

translation.en: Everyone has their own limitations of what they can handle,
translation.ko: 누구나 감당할 수 있는 것과 그렇지 못하는 것에 자신만의 한계점이 있어요

translation.en: and what they can't.
As the years passed, working in the Major Crimes unit, I…
translation.ko: 세월이 흐르면서 강력반에서 계속 일하다 보니…

translation.en: I found it harder to let it go.
[reporter 1] …Richland County deputies are looking for 61-year-old Lorraine Garcia,
translation.ko: 리칠랜드 카운티 경찰들이 61세의 로레인 가르시아를 찾고 있습니다

translation.en: last seen leaving Prisma Health Hospital. Originally, location…
translation.ko: 프리스마 헬스 병원을 나서는 게 마지막 모습이었는데…

translation.en: [Vicki] That's why I came to the Missing Person unit.
I realize that now I just need it to be a happy ending.
translation.ko: 이제는 결말이 행복한 걸 봐야겠다는 생각이 들었죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Tonight, deputies need your help to find Lorraine Garcia.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤, 로레인 가르시아에 대한 여러분의 제보를 기다립니다

translation.en: Investigators say she was last spotted leaving Prisma Health Hospital
translation.ko: 수사관들에 따르면 리칠랜드 카운티에 있는 프리스마 헬스 병원에서 나서는 게

translation.en: in Richland County.
Police believe she may be in danger.
[man on recording] I was over there and I remember
I was getting an air mattress.
And I was bringing supplies for the house because he had her…
translation.ko: 다른 물품들도 갖다 놨는데 토니가 어머니를 바닥에서 재우려고 했거든요

translation.en: he had her sleeping on the floor.
[Vicki] We got a tip I thought was really interesting.
[man] This was a good friend of mine, you know what I mean?
[Vicki] Yeah.
[man] And I got pretty close with the mother, you know what I'm saying?
I'd look at her as a mother figure towards me, you know what I'm saying?
[Vicki] The friend.
[man] That's why I felt like I needed to say something…
If something can be done,
I could never forgive myself if I didn't say anything.
translation.ko: 제가 아무 말 안 했다면 저 자신을 용서 못 할 거라서요

translation.en: [Vicki on recording] Right. So, he had her sleeping on just the floor,
translation.ko: 그렇죠, 그러니까 토니가 어머니를 바닥에 재우려고 해서

translation.en: so you got her an air mattress?
[man] I got her an air mattress. I got her new blankets. I got, um…
He was leaving her at the house all day, always asking for money.
translation.ko: 종일 어머니를 집에 놔두고 맨날 돈만 달랬거든요

translation.en: -It was bad. Yeah. -[Vicki] Wow. That's so sad.
[Vicki] He continually talks throughout that whole thing.
-Every time I listen to it, I catch more. -[officer] Yeah.
[Vicki] There is the issue of him selling his mother's home.
translation.ko: 어머니 집을 파는 데 문제가 있었잖아요

translation.en: [Heidi] We need to hold him accountable for selling that house.
It's not his to sell.
[Vicki] So, this guy, his mother's missing.
translation.ko: 이 남자 어머니가 몇 달째 실종 상태예요

translation.en: And she has been for a couple of months.
translation.ko: 이 남자 어머니가 몇 달째 실종 상태예요 "마이클 에드워즈 금융범죄 수사관"

translation.en: The house is empty, there's a strong smell of bleach,
translation.ko: 집은 텅 비었고 표백제 냄새가 진동하죠

translation.en: and there's shovels and things in the storage unit.
We're getting DNA, but he went on the internet,
translation.ko: DNA를 조사 중인데 이 사람이 어머니 집을 페이스북 마켓플레이스에

translation.en: on Facebook Marketplace, and listed her house for sale.
translation.ko: 이 사람이 어머니 집을 페이스북 마켓플레이스에 매물로 올렸어요

translation.en: I know there's a fraud charge because it's not his house.
translation.ko: 자기 명의가 아니니까 사기죄가 적용되는 건 아는데

translation.en: Are there any other charges that you know of?
Did he sign anything, or was it just done online?
translation.ko: 그 사람이 서명했나요? 온라인 거래만 했나요?

translation.en: [Vicki] He signed it.
-So he signed paperwork as well? -[Vicki] With his name.
Okay, um…
So you can charge him with forgery for the signature
if he's signing some sort of document that's untrue.
Even though he signed his name, it's… Since the document is fraud?
Yes. And you can also charge him as well, if it was done online.
You can charge him with… We have a Computer Crimes Act.
[Vicki] So we have concrete evidence to charge him for selling her house.
translation.ko: 집 매매 건으로 입건할 확실한 증거가 있어요

translation.en: Tony wants to come and pick up his truck, but we're going to arrest him.
translation.ko: 토니가 자기 트럭을 가지러 온다는데 그때 체포하죠

translation.en: [Vicki] Charging him with using a computer to commit a crime, forgery,
translation.ko: 입건 사유는 컴퓨터를 이용한 범죄 행위와 위조 및 2,500달러가 넘는 사기죄로 중죄에 해당함

translation.en: and false pretenses above $2,500. So it's a felony.
translation.ko: 위조 및 2,500달러가 넘는 사기죄로 중죄에 해당함

translation.en: [Vicki] So, he should be here any second.
Gonna go grab my phone in case he texts me.
[automated voice] Please leave your message.
[Vicki] Okay, this is him.
Who are all those people? I was not expecting that.
translation.ko: 저 사람들은 다 뭐죠? 이건 예상 못 했는데

translation.en: Another day in paradise.
[man] I heard that.
There is some stuff I need to talk to you about.
About her bank accounts and stuff like that.
translation.ko: 어머니 은행 계좌라든가 뭐 그런 거요

translation.en: Oh, like that. Okay, wow.
Well, I mean, she was always kind of secretive anyway.
Scorpio by nature.

but maybe I have to accept
Missing Persons isn't really that different.
